title: San Marcos Garden
description: Visit the heart of Aguascalientes. Surrounded by pink quarry stone and century-old trees, San Marcos Garden is the perfect place to stroll, take photos, and connect with local culture. A charming corner full of history  ideal for relaxing and experiencing the authentic spirit of Mexico.

title: Boca de Túnel Adventure Park
description: Boca de Túnel is an adventure park nestled among rocky canyons and a crystal-clear reservoir. It’s one of central Mexico’s best-kept secrets a place where wild nature, adrenaline, and breathtaking views come together in perfect harmony.

title: Railway Workers Museum
description: Housed in a former train station built in 1911, the Museo Ferrocarrilero de Aguascalientes is a time capsule that brings Mexico’s golden age of railroads back to life. This museum doesn’t just showcase original locomotives, railcars, and tools — it tells the human stories behind the progress: the workers, the travelers, and the dreams that once crossed the country on steel tracks.
